name: Batch-tools
tagline: Companion tools for the administration of DSpace content
body:
This code was created by the Georgetown University Libraries to assist in the management of DSpace.
Local customization will need to be performed before running this code.

Project Page: http://georgetown-university-libraries.github.io/batch-tools/

batch-tools Wiki: https://github.com/Georgetown-University-Libraries/batch-tools/wiki

See the [README](https://github.com/Georgetown-University-Libraries/batch-tools/blob/master/README.md) file for license information.

### Web-based tools for content owners that run independent of your user-facing instance
![Screen shot](https://raw.github.com/Georgetown-University-Libraries/batch-tools/gh-pages/doc/WikiScreenShots/overview1.jpg)

### Batch content administration tools -- hide the command line!
![Screen shot](https://raw.github.com/Georgetown-University-Libraries/batch-tools/gh-pages/doc/WikiScreenShots/overview2.jpg)

### Quality Control Reports tailored to your metadata standards
![Screen shot](https://raw.github.com/Georgetown-University-Libraries/batch-tools/gh-pages/doc/WikiScreenShots/overview3.jpg)

### You choose the features that you will enable
[Customization Steps](https://github.com/Georgetown-University-Libraries/batch-tools/wiki/Batch-tools-customization-steps)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
